1: <sup>1</sup> O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
2: <sup>2</sup> Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
3: <sup>3</sup> LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
4: <sup>4</sup> How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
5: <sup>5</sup> They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thine heritage.
6: <sup>6</sup> They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
7: <sup>7</sup> Yet they say, The LORD shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
8: <sup>8</sup> Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
9: <sup>9</sup> He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
10: <sup>10</sup> He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?
11: <sup>11</sup> The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
12: <sup>12</sup> Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;
13: <sup>13</sup> That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
14: <sup>14</sup> For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
15: <sup>15</sup> But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
16: <sup>16</sup> Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
17: <sup>17</sup> Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
18: <sup>18</sup> When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.
19: <sup>19</sup> In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
20: <sup>20</sup> Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
21: <sup>21</sup> They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
22: <sup>22</sup> But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.
23: <sup>23</sup> And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
